oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Notes kept by Union veteran Alexander Frazier on pensioners
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lt. Frazier served in Co. B, 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA and, after the war, as postmaster and railroad agent in Watauga Valley in Carter County, Tenn. He seems to have served as a facilitator for other Carter County Union veterans in their efforts to obtain a Federal pension for their Civil War service. These notes record names and unit affiliations and relevant genealogical information for scores of Carter County veterans of the 13th Cav. and other upper East Tennessee Union veterans.
